intro: Fuirena buchananii, commonly known as the Cape fynbos. It is a flowering plant native to South Africa, particularly found in the Western Cape region. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. It typically grows in coastal shrublands and fynbos vegetation, thriving in nutrient-poor soils. Fuirena buchananii is known for its small, yellowish flowers and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native habitat.
